front: When do you reach for an instance override instead of a type override?
back: Use an instance override when only one hierarchical path (e.g., a single agent) needs a different implementation. Type overrides affect every instance of that class.

front: Why are `::get_type()` handles preferred over string-based overrides in reusable VIP?
back: Handles are compile-time checked, preventing typos and allowing refactors. Strings are fragile and should be limited to scripting or high-level experiments.

front: How do you debug why a factory override did not apply?
back: Call `factory.print()` (typically in `end_of_elaboration_phase`) to list registered types and overrides, then confirm the hierarchical path or type matches the target.
